question.body: In question 1 you found that the margin of error of this poll was about 2.9%. What is the margin of error of the confidence interval you found in question 2? Comment on the apparent discrepancy.

explanation.p:
The 95% confidence interval for p, (.10,.14) has a width of .04, and therefore a margin of error of .02 (or 2%). In question 1, though, we found that the margin of error of this poll is roughly 2.9%. This is because in question 1, we calculated a
"conservative" margin of error. The margin of error found in question 1 was found using the conservative approach, and is the margin of error of the whole poll. What it says is:
Based on this sample size, the margin of error for any of the questions in this poll will be no more than 2.9% regardless of what the sample proportions are.
In the particular question from the poll in this example, the margin of error happened to be lower.
